content.description: This starts on opposing sidepulls and a glassy foot ledge, go directly up. The crux is probably the topout, but getting up to the undercling (small undercut corner) takes footwork. Once you're there, slap over the lip, and finesse your way onto the sloping ledge. It is a good problem.
content.protection: A pad will do and a spotter helps, it is a little high.
content.location: This boulder is right on the road, so it is basically a landmark.  The downclimb is probably harder than the problem, maybe V3+ hahah.

content.description:
Immediately right of

Undercling Route

, this is a strenuous friction problem that ascend the scoop via the arete and a small sideways crimp to a slopey finish.
This climbs the blank scoop on the far right of the Milton Boulder. Ascend small holds with awkward positions.

Pull onto SW face of Milton Boulder, and go up to the obvious crystal with your right hand and sloping crimper several feet up and to left of crystal with your left hand. From there, shoot to the top (the best hold is a little right of low point) and mantel.
content.protection: This is not highball, and it has good landing, but a pad is nice for the many falls from the lip that a moderate boulderer may take.
content.location:
This should be easy to find: if there is car parked West of Milton, it may block the problem. The SW face of Milton Boulder right of Milton problem has very difficult problems such as

Never Say Never

.

content.description:
This problem climbs the edge of the scoop left of "

Undercling Problem

".
content.location: Milton Boulder is an obvious formation, located on the north side of the Eldorado Canyon road, halfway between The Bastille Wall and Supremacy Slab.
